item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“h1 sk1ller, post:21, topic:360732”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=457038.msg3346422#msg3346422 date=1284866924]
This is 100% prims? The “blade” is not only messy, but appears to be only sharp on the tip. Why you have it rotating like that I don’t know. Also, for future reference, post UNTRIANGULATED models.
[/quote]

It is, he was showing me making the hilt on teamviewer and even I say its 100% prims XD[/quote]
Wtf happened to the blade then?

item.title: The Shadow Sabre
item.dc:creator: @pea2nuts pea2nuts
item.description:
@pea2nuts wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:10, topic:360732”][quote author=kirikugi link=topic=457038.msg3345541#msg3345541 date=1284820157]
no i asked you to do that b/c he is NEW and you have 200 rep so you obviously know more than me.so shut up or help the guy…
[/quote]
Then you could of pmed me instead of saying in the topic.

But fine let me tell him how he could fix the damn model up.

Clean the poly…
Make the blade come to a edge…
Use prims…[/quote]
THIS IS 100% PRIMS

I like the handle, but scrap the blade. Iz not so gud. Since you seem to be tracing, just try to make the blade neater. Try to extrude, the join the points along the edge so it is sharp. Also, keep the blade skinny, and the top of it flat, I've never seen a double-edged curved blade that isn't a scythe :3
also i didnt trace this i was just messing around with prims and made the handle and im redoing the blade

Read full topic

item.title: The Shadow Sabre
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

kirikugi:

no i asked you to do that b/c he is NEW and you have 200 rep so you obviously know more than me.so shut up or help the guy…

Just thought I would inform you: Rep does not mean jack shit. It is a stupid number in which is over abused for the slightest things. “omg nice theres a prim blade REP++” is an example of how some people feel the rep button works. You two are both being unbelievably childish.

On topic: The wire frame is absolutely horrid, sorry. The overall design is questionable at best. Why not just stick to basic primitive swords until you are able to use the tools well enough to manipulate a cube (or any other primitive) into the shape you want it?

Read full topic

Also, keep the blade skinny, and the top of it flat, I’ve never seen a double-edged curved blade that isn’t a scythe :3
